This city has four gates,
a strong iron wall;
I am shut in and shut out,
what evil have I done?
All the gates are closed,
I am shut out like a bird;
What is the reason, spirit,
that I am struck down by the wheel?
Having received a hundred thousand,
and more than twenty,
I did not doğŸ”½the words of my compassionate relatives.
I crossed the ocean, I went forth,
the ocean is not easy to cross;
From the four I went to the eight,
and from the eight to the sixteen.

translated: From the sixteen to the thirty-two,ğŸ”½I went to the thirty-three;
For a person who is struck down by desire,
the wheel turns on his head.
The upper roof is hard to fill,
desire goes its own way;
But those who follow it,
they carry the wheel.
Having taken many goods,
without considering the road;
For those who do not consider this,
they carry the wheel.
